qas.question: Greece is one of the members who founded what organization?
Which political philosophy does Greece follow?
When did Greece join the Eurozone?
Greece has the biggest economic power where?

context: Greece is a <a1_0>democratic<a1_0/> and developed country with an advanced high-income economy, a high quality of life and a very high standard of living. A founding member of the <a0_0>United Nations<a0_0/>, Greece was the tenth member to join the European Communities (precursor to the European Union) and has been part of the Eurozone since <a2_0>2001<a2_0/>. It is also a member of numerous other international institutions, including the Council of Europe, NATO,[a] OECD, OIF, OSCE and the WTO. Greece, which is one of the world's largest shipping powers, middle powers and top tourist destinations, has the largest economy in the <a3_0>Balkans<a3_0/>, where it is an important regional investor.
